Description:
Plant Operations Management:Supervise and coordinate all aspects of asphalt production, including material handling, batching, and mixing processes.
Monitor production schedules to ensure timely and efficient delivery of asphalt products.
Optimize plant performance and implement process improvements to increase productivity and reduce costs.
Ensure the plant operates in accordance with safety guidelines, maintaining a safe working environment for all employees.Quality Assurance:Maintain strict quality control standards to ensure that the asphalt produced meets industry specifications and customer requirements.
Conduct regular testing and analysis of asphalt samples to verify quality and consistency.
Implement corrective actions to address any deviations from quality standards.Maintenance and Repairs:Oversee the maintenance and repair of the asphalt plant's equipment and machinery.
Develop and implement a preventive maintenance program to minimize downtime and extend the lifespan of plant assets.
Coordinate with maintenance staff and external contractors to address mechanical issues promptly.Compliance and Environmental Regulations:Ensure compliance with all relevant environmental, health, and safety regulations related to asphalt production.
Keep up-to-date with industry standards and best practices, implementing necessary changes to remain compliant.Inventory and Logistics:Manage inventory levels of raw materials, chemicals, and finished products, ensuring adequate supply to meet production demands.
Coordinate logistics and transportation to deliver asphalt products to customers efficiently.Budget and Cost Management:Assist in developing the annual budget for the asphalt plant.
Monitor expenses and implement cost-saving measures without compromising quality or safety.Skills
Skills:
A Bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, or a related field is preferred.
Extensive experience (typically 10+ years) in asphalt plant operations, with a demonstrated track record of successful management.
Strong understanding of asphalt production processes, equipment, and quality control measures.
Knowledge of safety regulations and environmental standards related to asphalt production.
Excellent leadership and communication skills to effectively manage teams and communicate with stakeholders.
Problem-solving abilities and the capacity to make sound decisions under pressure.
Computer literacy and proficiency in relevant software applications for plant management.
Ability to work extended hours and weekends as necessary to meet production demands and address plant-related issues.
